finalproject

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalproject.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The controller is a means of my main GUI generating database files, accessing my database files, and passing objects (in my case, arraylists) between the view and the database.Contains methods which allow a user to extract arraylists from CSV files, overwrite CSV files with arraylists or indeed objects, and write new files. It also contains methods to handle the importing and exporting of files.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Doctor> extractDoctorList()
      Similar method exists for extracting an arraylist of patients from a file - here I can extract an arraylist of Doctor objects from any file.
      java.util.ArrayList<Patient> extractPatientList()
      Purpose: From the patient file name who have specified in the class (relative to the root of the class), an arraylist of patientlists can be generated Description: To ensure that the method waits for the full end of an expected row before doing its extraction (instead of looking for the next bit of whitespace), I hard code the fact that the array of tokens generated should be 11 tokens long, instead of being less or more.
      java.util.ArrayList<Patient> extractPatientList(java.io.File importfile)
      Purpose: From any CSV file with the correct specifications of entry types in each column (for example, the ID columns must be populated with integers, this method will generate an arraylist of Patient objects, assuming that each column of the CSV is essentially a variable for the Patient, placed in a specific order (which is the same order as the toString() method of Patient).
      void writeDoctorFile(java.util.ArrayList<Doctor> doctorlist)
      Writes to the absolute path of the doctor file if we have a new doctor registered, including first names and the password registered with.
      void writeExportFile(java.util.ArrayList<Patient> exportPatientList, java.io.File exportfile)
      Purpose: This method takes in an arraylist of patients to be exported, and the file location specified for the export, and then writes a CSV file of this arraylist of patients generated from the users selection Description: Because the file writer is false, if the file passed in as an argument exists already, it will be overritten.
      void writeNewDoctorFile()
      This method generates a new doctor file in the path specified.
      void writeNewPatientFile()
      This method generates a new patient file in the relative path specified.
      void writePatientFile(java.util.ArrayList<Patient> patientlist)
      This overwrites the patient file with the current value of the patientlist.

      • extractDoctorList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Doctor> extractDoctorList()
        Similar method exists for extracting an arraylist of patients from a file - here I can extract an arraylist of Doctor objects from any file.
        Returns:
        doctorlist A new arraylist of master doctors, obtained from the master database of doctors in the system.

      • extractPatientList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Patient> extractPatientList(java.io.File importfile)
        Purpose:
        From any CSV file with the correct specifications of entry types in each column (for example, the ID columns must be populated with integers, this method will generate an arraylist of Patient objects, assuming that each column of the CSV is essentially a variable for the Patient, placed in a specific order (which is the same order as the toString() method of Patient).
        References:
        http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/Development-Class/CSVfilewriter.htm http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/File-Input-Output/Writingdelimitedtextdatatoafileorastream.htm http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/File-Input-Output/Readeachlineinacommaseparatedfileintoanarray.htm http://examples.javacodegeeks.com/core-java/writeread-csv-files-in-java-example/ http://www.mkyong.com/java/how-to-read-and-parse-csv-file-in-java/ http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5797208/java-how-do-i-write-a-file-to-a-specified-directory http://viralpatel.net/blogs/java-read-write-csv-file/ http://examples.javacodegeeks.com/core-java/writeread-csv-files-in-java-example/ http://www.mkyong.com/java/how-to-write-to-file-in-java-bufferedwriter-example/
        Parameters:
        importfile - The file that is imported into the system, for which a patientlist needs to be generated and verified.
        Returns:
        patientlist An arraylist of patients to be verified.

      • extractPatientList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Patient> extractPatientList()
        Purpose:
        From the patient file name who have specified in the class (relative to the root of the class), an arraylist of patientlists can be generated
        Description:
        To ensure that the method waits for the full end of an expected row before doing its extraction (instead of looking for the next bit of whitespace), I hard code the fact that the array of tokens generated should be 11 tokens long, instead of being less or more.
        References:
        http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20086784/java-how-to-read-file-into-arraylist-of-objects http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7488643/how-to-convert-comma-separated-string-to-arraylist
        Returns:
        patientlist From any CSV file with the correct headers and the types of columns (int, String), return an arraylist of patients

      • writeExportFile

        public void writeExportFile(java.util.ArrayList<Patient> exportPatientList,
                            java.io.File exportfile)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Purpose:
        This method takes in an arraylist of patients to be exported, and the file location specified for the export, and then writes a CSV file of this arraylist of patients generated from the users selection
        Description:
        Because the file writer is false, if the file passed in as an argument exists already, it will be overritten.
        Parameters:
        exportfile - The file you want to export to
        exportPatientList - The patientlist the user has selected to export, via selecting rows in the JTable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an error if the buffered writer cannot be closed.

      • writePatientFile

        public void writePatientFile(java.util.ArrayList<Patient> patientlist)
                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This overwrites the patient file with the current value of the patientlist.
        Parameters:
        patientlist - The patientlist which we are going to use and one by one reset the master file, and append each object to.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found.

      • writeDoctorFile

        public void writeDoctorFile(java.util.ArrayList<Doctor> doctorlist)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Writes to the absolute path of the doctor file if we have a new doctor registered, including first names and the password registered with.
        Parameters:
        doctorlist - The doctorlist which we are going to use and one by one reset the master file, and append each object to.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - for if we don't have a doctor file to write to
